page.title: 06THE RIVER GRANTA IN LINTON
page.content: The river Granta,a tributary of the Cam,flows through the centre of Linton cutting the High Street in two. It is one of the village's greatest attractions. The river is pollution free and it contains eels,catfish and rainbow trout.There is an abundance of wildlife on the river banks including herons and kingfishers.There are also several species of duck including mallard,muscovy and teal.Recent additions include several Canada geese. The river used to flood the centre of the village quite regularly but in 1968,after a particularly serious flooding,the river was widened and a new bridge was built.This seems to have solved the problem.
